intro: Limeum viscosum var. kenyense, commonly known as the Kenyan sticky lime, is a variant of the sticky lime plant native to East Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellowish-green fruits. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. It is valued for its edible fruits, which have a tangy flavor and are used in local cuisines. The species is also noted for its ability to withstand drought conditions, making it an important plant in regions with limited water resources.
